title: [BEAM-7044] portable Spark: support stateful dofns
body:
Depends on #8802. We need a new custom group by key function so that we can run the executable stage function separately for each key, while keeping the original key/value pairs. Something I'm not too proud of here is re-using helper functions within typing constraints set by guava `Iterables.transform`. These are all pretty trivial functions I could've just as easily copied into lambdas or something, so let me know what you think. title: [WIP] [BEAM-7462] Update java SDK to report the SampledByteCount counter.

title: Make temp_location an attribute of the StandardOptions class
body:
Currently, the `--temp_location` argument is parsed by the `GoogleCloudOptions` class. However, `--temp_location` or a similar argument may be useful for other runners as well. For example, in the case of `DirectRunner`, `temp_location` may be the place where the runner stores its temporary files, if it ever supports out of process shuffles, combines, etc. In the case of `InteractiveRunner`, `temp_location` may be a good default location for the runner to store its cache files. In the case of the `WriteToFiles` transform, setting `temp_location` to `p.options.view_as(GoogleCloudOptions).temp_location` makes it appear as if `temp_location` has to be on GCS, which from my understanding, is not the case unless we are using the `DataflowRunner`? CC: @ivant @ananvay ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7510] Fixing fileio tests checking JSON serialization (flaky)
body:
The test was performing checking of `file.read() == json.dumps(someobject)` - which would be flaky due to different ordering of keys in a dictionary when serializing to JSON.

What it does now is `json.loads(file.read()) == someobject`

title: add compatibility check badges to README
body:
Hello google package maintainer,
The badges being added to the README in this PR will indicate your compatibility with other google packages. This addresses a set of user bugs which have happened when a user depends on two Cloud libraries (or runtimes that bundle libraries), say A and B, which both depend on library C. If the two libraries require different versions of C, the users can run into issues both when they pip install the libraries, and when they deploy their code. Our compatibility server checks that all libraries we make including this one are self and pairwise compatible as well as not having any deprecated dependencies. The two badges will mark the build for your project green when the latest version available on PyPI and github HEAD respectively meet all compatibility checks with itself and all other libraries. The badge target will link to a details page that elaborates on the current status. This should help you fix issues pre-release, to avoid user surprises. For more information, please take a look at our project charter at go/python-cloud-dependencies-project-charter and the badging PRD https://docs.google.com/document/d/1GYRFrfUou2ssY71AtnLkc8Sg1SD4dxqN4GzlatGHHyI/edit?ts=5c6f031d

R: @robertwb

title: [BEAM-7507] Use TextFormat to escape workIds to a string rather than utf8
body:
In StreamingDataflowWorker, when setting the workId for the logging MDC, currently the code attempts to decode a binary blob as utf8. This will (generally) cause a decoding error, and the java UTF8 decoder uses a globally synchronized cache to handle generating these error results. This can result in lock contention at high input rates. This simply changes it to use protobuf's TextFormat to escape the bytes to a string, preserving human readability for keys with text in them. @lukecwik ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7413] Fixes bug in partitioning of GroupNonMergingWindowsFunctions
body:
This is the same PR as #8743 but now applied to master --- We run our Beam pipelines on Spark. Since upgrading from Beam 2.8.0 to 2.12.0 we experience a very high number of tasks per stage (in the millions). The two relevant tickets that have introduced this behavior are: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5392 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4783 Both are good changes that should remain, no question there. The underlying issue is the HashPartioner that is used in the new GroupNonMergingWindowsFunctions#groupByKeyAndWindow method. The partitioner that used to be there would reduce the number of partitions to the parallelism that was set when the pipeline was started. The partitioner that is there now, does no longer do this. The fix: I have added the partitioner as an extra argument, so we can supply the same partitioner throughout the pipeline. Because the partitioner can be null, I have added the fallback to be the one that it was before: ``` private static Partitioner getPartitioner( Partitioner partitioner, JavaRDD>> rdd) { return partitioner == null ? new HashPartitioner(rdd.getNumPartitions()) : partitioner; } ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6777] Remove the unnecessary enable_health_checker flag
body:
It turns out the enable_health_checker flag introduced in PR #8681 is not actually needed. This is because the current implementation of the runner harness has already been set up to always respond HTTP 200 (healthy) on port 8081, even though it never get pinged. PR #8681 also fixed some style issue, so I am submitting this PR manually to revert the changes. r: @angoenka cc: @aaltay Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Gearpump | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-7478] Detect class path from the "java.class.path" property
body:
The current approach to assume the classloader is a UrlClassloader is fundamentally flawed because: - it relies on an implementation detail (cast to UrlClassloader) - UrlClassloader does not exist in Java >= 9 - UrlClassloader#getUrls() returns jars belonging to the JRE which leads to errors like the following: ``` Caused by: java.lang.IllegalAccessError: class sun.reflect.GeneratedSerializationConstructorAccessor70 cannot access its superclass sun.reflect.SerializationConstructorAccessorImpl ``` I've tested the approach here with a remote Flink cluster and got rid of the above error message. Apart from fixing the issue present, the changes will also make the jar detection code compatible with Java >= 9. title: [Beam 6611] Sketch for Integration Tests(failing) for BQ file loads in streaming
body:
Failing Integration Tests for BigQuery file loads in streaming pipelines. This is subtask 1 of my GSoC project. 1. The tests are similar to the tests for batch, with modifications to use TestStream. They make use of a kwarg `triggering_frequency` that will be used to control how often the load job for streaming pipelines needs to be triggered. 2. These can be merged into a single test function with a `streaming` flag to be passed by a test to reuse code and make it neater. However, I avoided it as of now, because if at all any bug is introduced in the tests, during the refactor, we don't have the implementation to validate it. Once the implementation is done, the tests can be refactored. 3. I haven't added the new tests to the Gradle file that contains the task `directRunnerIT` on which the tests that are supposed to run in streaming are run. Also because the new tests added are non-functional and only to illustrate the API changes needed. 4. Merging this is optional as this would, at present, add no value to the test suite. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-6620, BEAM-3606] Stop shading by default.
body:
This stops shading guava by default in all modules that don't have a custom shading configuration which is all modules except for: * model/* * sdks/java/core * sdks/java/extensions/kryo * sdks/java/extensions/sql * sdks/java/extensions/sql/jdbc * sdks/java/harness * runners/spark/job-server * runners/direct-java * runners/samza/job-server * runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker * runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/legacy-worker * runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/worker/windmill * vendor/* This migrates all modules except for the ones listed above so that: * publishing is based off of the unshaded jar and the unshaded test jar. * all intra module dependences use the compile (default) or testCompile configuration. * all dependencies within the module to use compile/testCompile/testRuntimeClasspath instead of shadow/shadowTest/shadowTestRuntimeClasspath **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7357] KinesisIO, remove stream existence check
body:
AWS Kinesis has a limit of 10 transactions of `DescribeStream` (which is used to check a stream) call per second per account. It will fail in case if we run a pipeline with many (>10) workers. So, we move the responsibility of this checking to AWS Kinesis. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-7427] Fix JmsCheckpointMark Avro Encoding
body:
`JmsCheckpointMark` can't be serialized with AvroCoder beause of the inner class `State` Avro schema generation of `JmsCheckpointMark` fails the externalisation of the inner class fixes the issue. title: [BEAM-7487] Avoid throwing an exception in FlinkRunnerResult#cancel
body:
The Flink Runner only returns a PipelineResult when the execution has finished successfully. Thus, we do not have to throw an "unsupported operation" exception when canceling. title: Fixing a typo
body:
Fixing a typo ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7407] Adds portable wordcount test for Python 3 with Flink runner.
body:
This PR extends the portable python precommit test suite with a Python 3 scenario. - The PR adds portable wordcount test for Python 3 with Flink running in-process runner and SDK harness running in Docker container. - To run Python 2 and Python 3 test scenarios in parallel, we add the Py3 scenario to a new project project sdks/python/test-suites/portable/py35/build.gradle inline with the proposal discussed in https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/7c48200678c570c6e42d4933f8ea4f9324d82f7ae720b591a93ffcda@%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E. - To reduce the duplication of Gradle code between Python 2 and Python 3 suites, we move the common the definition of Portable Wordcount task to to Beam Module Plugin. title: [BEAM-2943] Check existence of to-be-staged files in PipelineResources
body:
The current behavior to silently ignore non-existing files or directories has been a source of confusion for many users. This enforces a strict check to avoid leaving out essential dependencies which usually lead to unexpected failures during runtime, e.g. ClassNotFoundException. title: [BEAM-7413] Fixes bug in partitioning of GroupNonMergingWindowsFunctions
body:
We run our Beam pipelines on Spark. Since upgrading from Beam 2.8.0 to 2.12.0 we experience a very high number of tasks per stage (in the millions). The two relevant tickets that have introduced this behavior are: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-5392 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-4783 Both are good changes that should remain, no question there. The underlying issue is the HashPartioner that is used in the new GroupNonMergingWindowsFunctions#groupByKeyAndWindow method. The partitioner that used to be there would reduce the number of partitions to the parallelism that was set when the pipeline was started. The partitioner that is there now, does no longer do this. The fix: I have added the partitioner as an extra argument, so we can supply the same partitioner throughout the pipeline. Because the partitioner can be null, I have added the fallback to be the one that it was before: ``` private static Partitioner getPartitioner( Partitioner partitioner, JavaRDD>> rdd) { return partitioner == null ? new HashPartitioner(rdd.getNumPartitions()) : partitioner; } ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [X] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). I have contacted the #beam-spark slack channel and will add suggested reviewers as soon as I know the best person(s) to add. - [X] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [N/A] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Switch BigQueryStorageStreamSource to a BoundedSource
body:
The BigQuery Storage API's split implementation does not fit the model OffsetBasedSource expects, so in anticipation of adding split support on the client-side, I'm replacing the source to be a BoundedSource. Split will eventually unlock dynamic worker rebalancing for Google Cloud Dataflow. **Please** add a meaningful description for your change here ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-7449] Add pages documenting common Beam pipeline patterns (with code samples)
body:
Add common pipeline patterns to documentation. Each page describes a real-world data processing scenario and then demonstrates (with a code sample or psuedocode) how to complete it with the Beam SDK. This PR also updates the website section left nav JavaScript to prevent it (in a fixed position) from overflowing the main content element (dynamic sizing) on the docs pages. title: [BEAM-7357] KinesisIO: fix too many checks that writing stream exists.
body:
The operation `DescribeStream` has a limit of 10 transactions per second per account. So, `streamExists()` was moved to `Write.expand()`. Tested by `KinesisIOIT` as well. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-7412] shut down executor service in fn harness
body:
I was somewhat surprised to find that the unbounded thread growth I encountered when running portable validates runner tests on local Spark is was actually caused by [`GcsOptions.java`](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/39dab79b7bd56a47c0f2a02033ab4ca3bd4a67e2/sdks/java/extensions/google-cloud-platform-core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/gcp/options/GcsOptions.java#L150-L156). I'm guessing this hasn't caused problems before because the SDK harness was always run in a separately managed process/container/whatever that terminated when work was complete. Incidentally, this was a pain to track down because thousands of threads used for any number of purposes were all uniformly named `pool-N-thread-M` (as they all used Java's [`defaultThreadFactory`](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/Executors.html#defaultThreadFactory--)). Going forward, I might look into naming Beam threads so it's easier to debug and analyze performance. ------------------------ R: @angoenka Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Apex | Dataflow | Flink | Gearpump | Samza | Spark --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Apex/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-7203] Cherry-pick PR/8652 to the 2.13.0 release branch.
body:
https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/8130 makes fastavro library a default Avro implementation in Beam Avro IO for Python 3 and this change will be released in 2.13.0. https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/8652 instructs Dataflow runner to use fastavro as default implementation on Python 3 as well. This PR cherripicks this change. While not critical, it would be preferable to release both changes in the same release for consistent user experience, therefore I am proposing this cherry-pick for 2.13.0. title: [BEAM-7450] Support unbounded reads with HCatalogIO
body:
This PR adds the ability to add unbounded amounts of data using HCatalogIO 1. It extends PollFn which is responsible for emitting new partition indices when they become available 2. A reader which will read the partition that was jus emitted. R: @iemejia @lukecwik CC: @jkff (just for info or glad to receive feedback if you are interested). Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-7442][BEAM-5650] Read sequentially from bounded sources in UnboundedSourceWrapper
body:
Bounded sources are converted to unbounded sources using the BoundedToUnboundedSourceAdapter. This applies the streaming semantics for unbounded sources, which is to read round-robin from all sources after splitting. This doesn't work particularly well with a large number of files and leads to a large number of open file handles / connections. Instead, we can simple read the bounded sources sequentially.
